abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Competitiveness and
            Enterprise Development Project is to establish an enabling
            environment for private sector-led economic growth and
            poverty reduction in Rwanda. The project has four
            components: (i) improving business and legal environment
            which included financial sector development and its reforms;
            (ii) reducing cost and improving efficiency; (iii) promoting
            tea industry; and (iv) support to private sector federation
            and project coordinating unit. The reallocation of SDR
            56,911.89 into category four, incremental operating costs is
            necessary to enable the project coordinating unit to monitor
            and support full completion and implementation of the
            remaining activities before the project closing date, on
            July 31, 2011.
